intro: Draba steyermarkii, commonly known as the Steyermark's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Draba steyermarkii is a perennial herb with basal rosettes of narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are usually pale yellow or white, and it blooms from spring to early summer.
